Ta-Ying Cheng

D.Phil. Student
University of Oxford
ta-ying.cheng [at] cs.ox.ac.uk


About Me

I am a second year D.Phil. student in Computer Science at the University of Oxford. My study is co-supervised by Prof. Niki Trigoni and Prof. Andrew Markham and generously supported by the Taiwanese Government Scholarship to Study Abroad and the ACE-OPS grant. Prior to this, I worked as a research assistant in Computer Vision Lab, Academia Sinica, supervised by Prof. Tyng-Luh Liu and Prof. Hwann-Tzong Chen. I obtained my B.Eng. Computer Science degree from HKUST (First Class Honours), completing multiple projects under the guidance of Prof. Xiaojuan Ma, Prof. Dit-Yan Yeung, and Prof. Long Quan. I was an intern (and soon will be again!) at Adobe Research, working with Dr. Matheus Gadelha.

Research Interests

  • 3D Computer Vision, 3D Reconstruction, Deep Learning

News

  • [Dec. 2022] Defended my Transfer of Status viva (Examiners: Prof. Yarin Gal, Prof. Ronald Clark).

  • [Jun. 2022] Started my 3-month internship at Adobe Research!
  • [Dec. 2021] Our paper PADMix got accepted into AAAI 2022!
  • [Oct. 2021] Started my D.Phil. journey at the University of Oxford.
